channel.title: Looking Out The Window
channel.itunes:subtitle: Every song has a story
channel.itunes:summary: There is a story behind every song. Looking out the Window highlights the inspiration behind the music. Peak inside the musician's studio... and you just may be inspired yourself!
channel.itunes:author: Ed Roberts

item.title: Looking Out The Window – Episode 41, Just the music please. #3
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: It has been a LONG time. Thanks to the chaos of life, it’s been nearly a full SEASON since the last show was released. But, I’m back and ready to roll with some more great music. As things continue to gear-up, I decided to roll out another "Just The Music, Please" episode of the [...]
item.content:encoded:
It has been a LONG time. Thanks to the chaos of life, it’s been nearly a full SEASON since the last show was released. But, I’m back and ready to roll with some more great music. As things continue to gear-up, I decided to roll out another "Just The Music, Please" episode of the podcast. Some of this music you’ve heard before, others may be completely new. Either way, it feels great to be back, spending some time with you and listening to some great music.

  • "Building Our Own Future" – Howard Jones
  • "Hello, Hello" – Geoff Smith (new album is out!)
  • "Aint Go Love" – Todd Carey
  • "Annabelle" – David McMillin (new album to be released SOON)
  • "Bye, Bye Maggie" – Common Ground
  • "Temporary Life" – Carly Patterson
  • "Sorry" – Buckcherry


Opening theme… "One Question at at Time" – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network. Other mentions in this show include:

  • Laura Clapp
  • Marc Cohn

Podsafe Artists! Get involved i n the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking Out The Window – Episode 40, Five AM
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Thanks to a listener to the show, I found out about Five AM a few weeks ago. They’re out of northern California, and I really like their sound. Their third album, "Raise The Sun", dropped in February and has already spent some time in my playlist. I got a chance to chat with [...]
item.content:encoded:
Thanks to a listener to the show, I found out about Five AM a few weeks ago. They’re out of northern California, and I really like their sound. Their third album, "Raise The Sun", dropped in February and has already spent some time in my playlist. I got a chance to chat with Trent, the lead singer of the band about their music and how fans have helped to finance their albums.

  • "Be Still"
  • "Just Say Anything"
  • "Fall Apart"

Opening and closing theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network and Ariel Publicity .

Podsafe Artists! Get involved i n the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at +1-206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking Out The Window – Episode 39, Sarah Vonderhaar
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: I’m very excited to bring you an interview with a spectacular upcoming artist, Sarah Vonderhaar . Her catchy and upbeat songs complement her solid vocals, and I really enjoyed sitting down with her to talk about her music. Her debut album, "Are You Listening Now" drops on April 22. If you are seeing [...]
item.content:encoded:
I’m very excited to bring you an interview with a spectacular upcoming artist, Sarah Vonderhaar . Her catchy and upbeat songs complement her solid vocals, and I really enjoyed sitting down with her to talk about her music. Her debut album, "Are You Listening Now" drops on April 22. If you are seeing this prior to the 22nd, you can pre-order the album over at SarahVonderhaar.com . I have been enjoying a copy of it quite a bit over the last couple of weeks, and if you like her mix of pop/rock in this show, you’ll love the full album. SarahVonderhaar.com Sarah’s MySpace Page Sarah’s Facebook Page

  • "Let My Heart Fall"
  • "I Got Sunshine"
  • "It’s Not the First Time"
  • "Are You Listening Now?"
  • "Just Go"
  • "Sing Me To Sleep"

Opening and closing theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network and Ariel Publicity . Other music used with permission of the artist.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved i n the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at +1-206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking Out The Window – Episode 38, Natalie Gelman
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Thanks to Chris Penn at the Financial Aid Podcast, I learned of New York artist Natalie Gelman. Natalie and I sat down at the beginning of March to talk about her music, some of the experiences and doors that have opened from her performances in the New York subway system and elsewhere, and the stories [...]
item.content:encoded:
Thanks to Chris Penn at the Financial Aid Podcast, I learned of New York artist Natalie Gelman. Natalie and I sat down at the beginning of March to talk about her music, some of the experiences and doors that have opened from her performances in the New York subway system and elsewhere, and the stories behind her songs. She describes her music as acoustic-folk-rock, but her voice spans many different genre (even opera). Thanks again Natalie! If you like her music, consider supporting her by purchasing her latest album.

NatalieGelman.com
Natalie’s MySpace Page

  •  ”Never Had You”
  • “Always Was”
  • “Sweet July”
  • “Forgive Me”
  • “When Will I Be Loved”
  • “Run Away”
  • “Rest of the Way”

Opening and closing theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking Out The Window, Episode 37 – Tangled in Strings
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description:
Looking out the Window, Episode 37 – Tangled in Strings Sometimes we get tangled up in the chaos of life, relationships, and it takes a change of heart to move, change, and evolve. Thanks again to Grace Buford and David McMillin for submissions for this episode.
“Two Car Garage” – Cool Waters Band “Tangled [...]
item.content:encoded:
Looking out the Window, Episode 37 – Tangled in Strings

Sometimes we get tangled up in the chaos of life, relationships, and it takes a change of heart to move, change, and evolve. Thanks again to Grace Buford and David McMillin for submissions for this episode.

  • “Two Car Garage” – Cool Waters Band
  • “Tangled in Strings” – Grace Buford
  • “Annabelle” – David McMillin
  • “Almost Flew” – Jeff Caylor
  • “Sunkissed Days” – Maren Morris

Opening and closing theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Music for this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

item.title: Looking Out The Window, Episode 36 – Laura Clapp
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: After a year and a half, I finally got a chance to sit down and re-record an interview with the beautiful and talented Laura Clapp. Laura’s music has been compared to Martina McBride and Shania Twain, but has a feel all it’s own. I fell in love with her music at a live [...]
item.content:encoded:
After a year and a half, I finally got a chance to sit down and re-record an interview with the beautiful and talented Laura Clapp. Laura’s music has been compared to Martina McBride and Shania Twain, but has a feel all it’s own. I fell in love with her music at a live show in Kansas City 2 years ago. She has a brand new live album out called “Leaving NashVegas.” Pick up a copy of that or one of her previous albums and make sure you catch her at a live show in Nashville or in Cleveland. You will not be disappointed.

  • “Something About You” (Leaving NashVegas)
  • “Just Let Go” (Leaving NashVegas)
  • “Back To Us” (Leaving NashVegas)
  • “Not For Me” (Single)
  • “Hey Hey Sister” (Simply)
  • “The Other Half of Me” (Simply)
  • “Gotta Be Me” (Simply)

Opening and closing theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking Out The Window, Episode 35 – Matthew Ebel, Part 2
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: The second half of my interview with now Boston-based artist Matthew Ebel. We talk about the inspiration and meaning of some of his songs and soak in some great music. We even talk about how you can get a FREE song from Matt that you will not be able to get anywhere else. [...]
item.content:encoded:
The second half of my interview with now Boston-based artist Matthew Ebel. We talk about the inspiration and meaning of some of his songs and soak in some great music. We even talk about how you can get a FREE song from Matt that you will not be able to get anywhere else. Thank you again Matthew! If you don’t own any of Matthew’s music, you are missing out. His latest album, Goodbye Planet Earth, is awesome, AS is his last album, Beer and Coffee.

  • “All I Want is You” (Filling the Pages)
  • “Trees” (Beer and Coffee)
  • “Sally Went Down” (Filling the Pages)
  • “Walk a Thousand Miles” (Single)
  • “Join The Conversation” (Goodbye Planet Earth)

Purchase Matt’s music from MatthewEbel.com or iTunes

Opening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: Looking out the Window, Episode 34 – Matthew Ebel, Part 1
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: I was thrilled to be able to sit down with Nashville (soon Boston) artist Matthew Ebel to talk about his music, his new album, and when he discovered that new media would make a significant impact on his career. Of course, we go through a slew of his songs, old and new, and find out [...]
item.content:encoded:
I was thrilled to be able to sit down with Nashville (soon Boston) artist Matthew Ebel to talk about his music, his new album, and when he discovered that new media would make a significant impact on his career. Of course, we go through a slew of his songs, old and new, and find out the inspiration and message he is conveying though them. Thank you SO much Matthew! If you don’t own any of Matthew’s music, you are missing out. His latest album, Goodbye Planet Earth, is awesome, AS is his last album, Beer and Coffee.

  • “I Will Wait for You”(Goodbye Planet Earth)
  • “Lost My Way”(Goodbye Planet Earth)
  • “I Know You’re There”(Beer and Coffee)
  • “Drive Away” (Beer and Coffee)

Purchase Matt’s music from MatthewEbel.com or iTunes

Opening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

DOWNLOAD THE SHOW DIRECTLY

item.title: LOTW-033, It’s About Time
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Looking out the Window, Episode 33 – It’s About Time A special edition of Looking Out The Window where I give you an idea of what some songs mean to me… AND I want YOU to tell the stories of podsafe songs that mean something special to you. Why to they mean so much [...]
item.content:encoded:
Looking out the Window, Episode 33 – It’s About Time

A special edition of Looking Out The Window where I give you an idea of what some songs mean to me… AND I want YOU to tell the stories of podsafe songs that mean something special to you. Why to they mean so much to you? Call the listener line at +1-206-666-LOOK and be a part of a future edition of Looking Out The Window!

  • “Never Give It Up” – Crossfire
  • “Lost My Way” – Matthew Ebel
  • “It’s About Time” – Kevin Reeves
  • “Shine” – Kevin Reeves

Opening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

item.title: LOTW-032, Reflections of Meaning
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Looking out the Window, Episode 32 – Reflections of Meaning We all seem to search for meaning in life. We search for relevancy, reasons circumstances are the way they are, and search for direction for the future. Yet, no matter where you are at in life, it’s comfortaing to know you can be happy with [...]
item.content:encoded:
Looking out the Window, Episode 32 – Reflections of Meaning

We all seem to search for meaning in life. We search for relevancy, reasons circumstances are the way they are, and search for direction for the future. Yet, no matter where you are at in life, it’s comfortaing to know you can be happy with who you are. Great music this episode. Special thanks to Mitch Alden from Now is Now and Whitney Steele for their submissions for this episode.

“After The Pain” – David Grow
“Days of Summer” – Now is Now
“Movie Star” – Whitney Steele
“Hey, Hey Sister” – Laura Clapp Opening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis

Some of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

item.title: LOTW-031, New Perspectives
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Looking out the Window, Episode 31 – New Perspectives We often reach those points in our life where we gain a new perspective on many things. But it’s often our response to these new perspectives that determine our future. Do new perspectives prompt you to move? Special thanks to Edie Carey and Mitch Alden [...]
item.content:encoded:
Looking out the Window, Episode 31 – New Perspectives

We often reach those points in our life where we gain a new perspective on many things. But it’s often our response to these new perspectives that determine our future. Do new perspectives prompt you to move? Special thanks to Edie Carey and Mitch Alden from Now is Now for their submissions for this episode.

“Lost My Way” – Matthew Ebel (pre-order his new album, “Goodbye Planet Earth”)
“Chemistry” – Edie Carey
“Walk the Line” – Now is Now
“Aint Got Love” – Todd CareyOpening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis All of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.

 

Podsafe Artists! Get involved in the podcast! Contact me at artist [a t ] lookingoutthewindow.com or use the voicemail line at 206-666-LOOK (5665).

item.title: LOTW-30, The Sun Again Will Shine
item.dc:creator: Ed Roberts
item.description: Looking out the Window, Episode 30 -The Sun Again Will Shine   We all go through times of trouble, stress, and re-evaluation. It’s often in these times where we find our true strengths. Thank you to Beth Thornley and Mitch Alden from Now is Now for their submissions for this episode. “Rain” – Matthew Ebel [...]
item.content:encoded:
Looking out the Window, Episode 30 -The Sun Again Will Shine

 

We all go through times of trouble, stress, and re-evaluation. It’s often in these times where we find our true strengths. Thank you to Beth Thornley and Mitch Alden from Now is Now for their submissions for this episode.

“Rain” – Matthew Ebel (pre-order his new album, “Goodbye Planet Earth”)
“You’re Right Where” – Beth Thornley
“Walk the Line” – Now is Now
“Sun Again Will Shine” – slackstring Opening theme… “One Question at at Time” – Van Davis All of this episode’s music can be found over at the Podsafe Music Network.
